wikipedia_page.main: Stuart Ellis Storey (born 6 September 1942) is a British sports commentator and former 110m hurdler.

response: * Stuart Storey – BBC Sport 1973–2008, 2010–2017, Setanta Sports 2006–2009 (With BBC for Diamond League World Feed)
* Stuart Storey — athlete and sports commentator; long associated with Ware and the Wodson Park Sports facility

Capes was born in 1949 in Holbeach, Lincolnshire, the seventh of nine children. He was the seventh child of Eileen Capes, though the eldest of her three children by her third husband Bill Capes. Of his older siblings, the elder two were Braithwaites and the middle four Cannons.Geoff Capes, Big Shot, (Hutchinson (April 1981)), ,  He grew up in the town and went to the local secondary school, George Farmer. He became a member of Holbeach Athletic Club where he was coached by Stuart Storey. He was a gifted sportsman, and represented Lincolnshire at basketball, football and cross-country. In addition he was a decent sprinter, running 23.7 s for the 200 m. Growing up on the Lincolnshire fens he had an early fascination with the natural world and cared for injured birds and animals from when he was a young boy.Profile on official site After school he worked as a coalman and an agricultural labourer, being able to load twenty tons of potatoes in twenty minutes. He joined Cambridgeshire Constabulary in 1970, and remained in the police for ten years.
